title: uBlock filter list to hide all YouTube Shorts
summary:
This document describes a uBlock Origin filter list designed to completely hide all YouTube Shorts videos. Users can implement it by copying the provided link (`https://raw.githubusercontent.com/i5heu/ublock-hide-yt-shorts/master/list.txt`) and pasting it into the "Import..." section found within the "Filter lists" tab of their uBlock Origin Dashboard.

As a bonus, a separate filter list is offered to hide YouTube comments, available at `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/i5heu/ublock-hide-yt-shorts/master/comments.txt`, which is imported using the same method.

The project is currently maintained by "i5heu," who took over maintenance after the original creator, @gijsdev, became inactive for an extended period. The initiative explicitly states it is an independent, open-source project with no affiliation, endorsement, or association with Alphabet Inc., Google LLC, or YouTube. Further details on contributing and licensing can be found in `CONTRIBUTING.md` and `LICENSE.md` respectively.
chinese_title: 隐藏所有 YouTube 短视频的 uBlock 过滤器列表
chinese_summary:
本文档描述了一个uBlock Origin过滤列表，旨在完全隐藏所有YouTube Shorts视频。用户可以通过复制提供的链接（`https://raw.githubusercontent.com/i5heu/ublock-hide-yt-shorts/master/list.txt`），并将其粘贴到其uBlock Origin控制面板中“过滤列表”标签页内的“导入...”部分来实现此功能。

此外，作为一项额外福利，还提供了一个单独的过滤列表，用于隐藏YouTube评论，可在 `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/i5heu/ublock-hide-yt-shorts/master/comments.txt` 获取，其导入方法与上述相同。

该项目目前由“i5heu”维护，他在原作者@gijsdev长期不活跃后接管了维护工作。该倡议明确指出，这是一个独立的开源项目，与Alphabet Inc.、Google LLC或YouTube没有任何从属关系、认可或关联。有关贡献和许可的更多详细信息，可分别在 `CONTRIBUTING.md` 和 `LICENSE.md` 中找到。

title: I love the work of the ArchWiki maintainers
summary:
On "I love Free Software Day," the author expresses deep gratitude to Free Software documentation maintainers, especially those of the ArchWiki. The piece highlights that these contributors often receive insufficient recognition for their vital work.

The ArchWiki is lauded as an invaluable resource frequently consulted by the author and many others, irrespective of whether they use Arch Linux or another distribution. It has consistently helped the author understand daily tools like email programs and window managers, discover hidden features, and troubleshoot GNU/Linux setup issues for themselves and others. It's often the first place consulted for software understanding.

The author echoes Edward Snowden's praise, who called the ArchWiki a rare beacon of useful information amidst declining search result quality. The article concludes by thanking all ArchWiki contributors for sharing knowledge and maintainers for ensuring its long-term availability and reliability. Readers are encouraged to express their appreciation and consider donating to the Arch project.
chinese_title: 我爱ArchWiki维护者们的工作
chinese_summary:
在“我爱自由软件日”之际，作者对自由软件文档维护者，尤其是ArchWiki的维护者，表达了深深的感谢。文章强调，这些贡献者们所做的至关重要的工作，常常未被充分认可。

ArchWiki被赞誉为一份宝贵的资源，作者和许多其他人，无论他们使用Arch Linux还是其他发行版，都经常查阅它。它始终帮助作者理解电子邮件程序和窗口管理器等日常工具，发现隐藏功能，并为自己和他人解决GNU/Linux设置问题。在理解软件时，它往往是首选的查阅之处。

作者赞同爱德华·斯诺登的赞扬，斯诺登曾称ArchWiki是“在搜索结果质量日益下降的情况下，一个罕见的有用信息灯塔”。文章最后感谢所有ArchWiki贡献者分享知识，以及维护者确保其长期可用性和可靠性。鼓励读者表达他们的感激之情，并考虑向Arch项目捐款。

title: OpenAI has deleted the word 'safely' from its mission
summary:
OpenAI has controversially removed the word "safely" from its mission statement, signaling a significant shift in its priorities from safety to profit. Its 2023 mission aimed "to build artificial intelligence that safely benefits humanity, unconstrained by a need to generate financial return." However, its 2024 IRS filing shows the mission updated to "to ensure that artificial general intelligence benefits all of humanity," omitting both "safely" and the financial independence clause.

This change coincided with OpenAI's transformation from a nonprofit into a business increasingly focused on profits, driven by the immense capital required for AI development. In October 2025, it formally restructured into a nonprofit OpenAI Foundation and a for-profit OpenAI Group. The Foundation now owns only 26% of the Group, effectively ceding majority control, while major investors like Microsoft hold significant stakes. This move attracted billions in new investments, increasing OpenAI's valuation to over $500 billion.

The author, a scholar of nonprofit accountability, views this as a critical, underreported shift, especially given pending lawsuits against OpenAI alleging psychological manipulation and wrongful death. While the new structure includes some safety committees, the removal of "safely" from the core mission makes accountability challenging. The author criticizes OpenAI's board and the Attorneys General of California and Delaware for allowing this, suggesting alternative models where nonprofits retained greater control over their for-profit counterparts would better serve the public interest.
chinese_title: OpenAI 从其使命中删除了“安全地”一词。
chinese_summary:
OpenAI争议性地从其使命宣言中删除了“安全地”一词，这预示着其优先事项已从安全转向利润，发生了重大转变。其2023年的使命旨在“构建能够安全地造福人类的人工智能，不受制于创造经济回报的需求”。然而，其2024年提交给美国国税局的文件显示，使命已更新为“确保通用人工智能造福全人类”，删去了“安全地”以及财务独立条款。

这一变化恰逢OpenAI从一个非营利组织转型为一个日益关注利润的商业实体，这主要是由人工智能开发所需巨额资本所驱动的。2025年10月，它正式重组为非营利性的OpenAI基金会和营利性的OpenAI集团。基金会目前仅持有集团26%的股份，实际上已放弃了多数控制权，而微软等主要投资者则持有大量股份。此举吸引了数十亿美元的新投资，使OpenAI的估值超过5000亿美元。

作者是一位非营利组织问责制学者，他认为这是一个关键但未被充分报道的转变，尤其考虑到针对OpenAI的诉讼悬而未决，这些诉讼指控其涉及心理操控和不当致死。尽管新结构包含一些安全委员会，但从核心使命中移除“安全地”一词，使得问责变得困难。作者批评OpenAI董事会以及加利福尼亚州和特拉华州的检察长允许这种情况发生，并建议采用其他模式，即非营利组织对其营利性对应实体保留更大的控制权，这将更好地服务于公共利益。

title: Ooh.directory: a place to find good blogs that interest you
summary:
Ooh.directory is presented as a curated online directory designed to help users discover interesting blogs across a diverse range of subjects. The platform categorizes blogs using emoji icons and provides a count for each category, which includes Arts and Media, Computers, Internet, Tech, Countries, Economics and Business, Education, Government, Politics and Law, Humanities, Personal blogs, Recreation, Science, and Society, alongside unique categories like "Uncategorizable blogs."

The directory facilitates content discovery through sections like "Recently added blogs" and "Recently updated blogs." Each blog entry offers key information: its title, a brief description of its content, the author (if provided), the country of origin (indicated by a flag), and the timestamp of its last update. Furthermore, a snippet from the latest blog post is included, giving users an immediate insight into current content. The featured examples illustrate the breadth of topics, from personal anecdotes and travelogues to academic discussions, technology reviews, and niche hobbies, making Ooh.directory a comprehensive resource for finding engaging and active online journals.
chinese_title: Ooh.directory: a place to find good blogs that interest you
chinese_summary:
Ooh.directory 被定位为一个精心策划的在线目录，旨在帮助用户发现涵盖各种不同主题的有趣博客。该平台使用表情符号图标对博客进行分类，并提供每个类别的数量统计，其中包括艺术与媒体、计算机、互联网、科技、国家、经济与商业、教育、政府、政治与法律、人文科学、个人博客、娱乐、科学和社会，以及“无法分类的博客”等独特类别。

该目录通过“最近添加的博客”和“最近更新的博客”等版块，帮助用户发现内容。每个博客条目都提供关键信息：其标题、内容简介、作者（如果提供）、来源国家（通过旗帜表示）以及上次更新的时间戳。此外，还包括最新博客文章的摘要，让用户能即时了解当前内容。展示的示例说明了主题的广泛性，从个人轶事和游记，到学术讨论、技术评论和小众爱好，使 Ooh.directory 成为一个全面的资源，用于寻找引人入胜且活跃的在线期刊。

title: My smart sleep mask broadcasts users' brainwaves to an open MQTT broker
summary:
The author reverse-engineered a smart sleep mask from Kickstarter after its official app proved buggy. Using Claude (Opus 4.6), they initially attempted Bluetooth protocol mapping, but it was non-standard. Claude then decompiled the Android Flutter app's APK, analyzing strings in the compiled Dart binary. This revealed critical information: hardcoded credentials for the company's MQTT message broker, cloud API endpoints, command function names, and the packet structure. Further analysis with `blutter` allowed Claude to fully map all fifteen device commands, enabling control over features like vibration, heating, and electrical muscle stimulation (EMS) via a custom web dashboard.

The alarming discovery came when Claude used the hardcoded MQTT credentials to connect to the company's message broker. The broker was open and actively broadcasting live EEG brainwave data from approximately 25 active sleep masks, as well as data from other IoT devices like air quality monitors. This meant the author could read real-time brainwave activity from strangers globally. Crucially, because all devices share the same credentials and broker, an attacker could not only monitor brainwaves but also send electrical impulses (EMS) to other users in their sleep. The author has disclosed the issue to the unnamed company and highlighted the importance of "Digital Hygiene." Claude completed the entire reverse engineering process autonomously in 30 minutes.
chinese_title: 我的智能睡眠眼罩将用户脑电波广播到一个开放的MQTT代理。
chinese_summary:
作者在官方应用出现问题后，对一款购自 Kickstarter 的智能睡眠眼罩进行了逆向工程。使用 Claude (Opus 4.6)，他们最初尝试进行蓝牙协议映射，但发现该协议并非标准。Claude 随后反编译了这款安卓 Flutter 应用的 APK，并分析了编译后的 Dart 二进制文件中的字符串。这揭示了关键信息：该公司 MQTT 消息代理的硬编码凭据、云 API 端点、命令函数名称以及数据包结构。借助 `blutter` 进一步分析，Claude 能够完全映射所有十五个设备命令，从而可以通过一个自定义的网页仪表板控制振动、加热和电肌肉刺激 (EMS) 等功能。

当 Claude 使用硬编码的 MQTT 凭据连接到该公司的消息代理时，一个令人震惊的发现浮出水面。该代理是开放的，并正在积极广播来自大约 25 个活跃睡眠眼罩的实时脑电波 (EEG) 数据，以及来自空气质量监测器等其他物联网设备的数据。这意味着作者可以读取来自全球陌生人的实时脑电波活动。至关重要的是，由于所有设备共享相同的凭据和代理，攻击者不仅可以监测脑电波，还可以向其他正在熟睡的用户发送电脉冲 (EMS)。作者已向这家未具名公司披露了该问题，并强调了“数字卫生”的重要性。Claude 仅用 30 分钟就自主完成了整个逆向工程过程。

title: Ars Technica makes up quotes from Matplotlib maintainer; pulls story
summary: The article reports that tech publication Ars Technica faced controversy for allegedly fabricating quotes attributed to the maintainer of the Matplotlib library. Following these allegations, Ars Technica subsequently pulled the problematic story from its site. This incident sparked discussion, as indicated by a partial quote from "Taggart" on Infosec Exchange (likely a Mastodon post), commenting on the Matplotlib maintainer's involvement or the situation at large.
chinese_title: Ars Technica makes up quotes from Matplotlib maintainer; pulls story
chinese_summary: The article reports that tech publication Ars Technica faced controversy for allegedly fabricating quotes attributed to the maintainer of the Matplotlib library. Following these allegations, Ars Technica subsequently pulled the problematic story from its site. This incident sparked discussion, as indicated by a partial quote from "Taggart" on Infosec Exchange (likely a Mastodon post), commenting on the Matplotlib maintainer's involvement or the situation at large.
